content.description: Match on jug to the right of blue rectangle. Pull right and follow crack system
content.location: Just to the right of Tit for tat. Starts on same right hand jug

content.description: Start left low as possible on lip and right on jug. Work your way up the lip and tip out lip to the left. Any jugs to the right other than start hold are off
content.location: Located on boulder with a blue rectangle spray painted on it. Just to the right of "loose lips sink ships"

content.description: Start on the left side of the boulder following the obvious edges to the right. When you reach the top traverse to the point and top out.
content.protection: Multiple Pads and a Spotter is recommended    Very sketchy landing
content.location: Once you get to the miners boulders make your way down below Alpine Gin the face is marked with three verticals spray paint lines

content.description: Sit start on right side of boulder on good crimp rail and then traverse left. Top out at about the middle on the boulder
content.location: Located on the opposite of close quarter

content.description: Start on left side of face and move right making powerful moves with a couple left hand heel matches. Jug in the middle of routes seems suspect use with caution.
Work through a fallen boulder covered in small sandy dimples. No defined good holds.
content.protection: Crash Pad and Spotter. Landing is somewhat on a slope make sure you don't roll down the hill.
content.location: Somewhat difficult to get to. Find the large fallen boulders that make a small cavern. Get down below them. A large boulder sticks out near the entrance to the cavern. You'll see the dimples.

content.description: Start on the same hold as Countrytime Lemonade and then traverse left across the lip. Catch the jug far out left and top out.
Start on lowest set of jugs and make your way up to the fun and commiting top out! Super chill with an amazing view of the Mississippi Valley
content.location: Lone Boulder just to the right of close quarter and Rosie Traverse

content.description: Start on the right side of the boulder in the big pockets and your feet on the pebbles on the underside of the rock. Heel hook and power your way to the two crimps above and top out.
content.location: Go down the hill into the heart of the miners boulders you can't miss it.

content.description: start with a big move up to the jug, then make powerful moves out right. Set a high heel and top out.Â
Start low in shallow crack system and make big move to a jug. Continue up obvious slopey jugs to the top. With some cleaning this route may become easier
content.location: On the Jesus boulder (tallest boulder) behind "loose lips sinks ships". If facing the boulder is located in the middle of the right face

content.description: Start on chossy sloper rail and reach for an amazing 3 finger pocket then make your way to the canal. Suck your belly in and squeeze through the canal. Be careful of your head while falling
content.location: Starts on same holds as close quarter

content.description: Small exposed face with a well defined ledge. Start far right on the ledge above the small evergreen. Traverse left heal hooking your way through. Top out at the jutout. Crux is at the end of the traverse moving into the upclimb.
content.location: Go left at the miner's access point. Hike down the path. It's on the right.

content.description: A random collection of fallen rock and small exposed faces. The boulders and faces are scatterd about south of The Point.
